google-analytics.com.explanation: Google Analytics is commonly used to track website traffic and user interactions.

www.google-analytics.com.explanation: Google Analytics is commonly used to track website traffic and user interactions.

googletagmanager.com.explanation: Google Tag Manager dynamically injects tracking and analytics scripts.

doubleclick.net.explanation: DoubleClick is an advertising platform used for cross-site user tracking and ad targeting.

securepubads.g.doubleclick.net.explanation: Google Ad Manager delivers targeted advertisements using cross-site tracking.

adsafeprotected.com.explanation: AdSafe is used to verify and track ad impressions and placements.

scorecardresearch.com.explanation: Scorecard Research collects audience measurement and analytics data.

quantserve.com.explanation: Quantserve provides traffic measurement and audience analytics.

hotjar.com.explanation: Hotjar records user behavior such as clicks and scrolls for analytics purposes.

clarity.ms.explanation: Microsoft Clarity records user interactions for UX analytics.

facebook.net.explanation: Facebook tracking services enable cross-site advertising and user profiling.

connect.facebook.net.explanation: Facebook Pixel tracks users across sites for ad targeting.

amazon-adsystem.com.explanation: Amazon Ad System delivers personalized advertisements using tracking data.

chartbeat.com.explanation: Chartbeat provides real-time analytics on user engagement.

optimizely.com.explanation: Optimizely runs experiments and tracks user behavior for A/B testing.

cdn.optimizely.com.explanation: Optimizely content delivery used for experimentation and analytics.

piano.io.explanation: Piano tracks user engagement and subscription behavior.

experience.piano.io.explanation: Piano Experience is used for audience analytics and personalization.
